name: cavernously
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows how big and empty a space is: When the hall is not full, the space can look cavernously empty. The voices of the cyclists passing through the tunnel resonated cavernously.
More examplesFewer examplesThe boot may not be the longest or widest available, but it is cavernously deep.The new stadium is cavernously large, smart, and airy. The butler showed us into a cavernously gloomy living room cluttered with Roman busts, gilded mirrors, and massive old oil paintings.
